Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(2) Summary

APIs have been around for many decades and sometimes the question gets asked why there currently is so much talk about APIs. There are two main reasons for this: One reason is that organizations nowadays have to focus on improving their agility, and APIs provide the connective fabric to create flexible and changeable landscapes of modularized capabilities. The second reason is that with digital technologies taking the front stage everywhere, we now understand that business strategy and technical architecture must be aligned, and APIs therefore are becoming the language that interconnects business capabilities. Microproducts are the logical conclusion of these two driving forces, and in this presentation we take a look at what this means for IT architects and software developers.

Why Microproducts? Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(7) Why Microservices are Good

  • Shift the focus to self-contained capability implementations
  • Shift the focus to capabilities being available through an API
  • Microservices are SOA Done Right (i.e., decentralization matters)
  • It all looked so promising, but thenâ¦


Why Microproducts? Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(8) Why Microservices are Problematic

  • MSA's goal is to design and implement encapsulated capabilities
    1. Identify and design business-aligned capabilities
    2. Implement these so that they can be independently deployed
  • Containerization is one microservice implementation option
  • Container Cargo Cult removes the focus from doing the right thingâ¦
    • â¦and doing the thing right doesn't need containers either


Why Microproducts? Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(9) Microproducts



Why Microproducts? Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(10) Products: Designed for Scale



Why Microproducts? Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(11) API Products: Digital Building Blocks

  • Every capability is made available as a digital building block
  • Designing and providing building blocks is a shared practice
  • Building blocks are aligned with business and technology strategy
    • Business aligned because they represent business capabilities
    • Technology aligned because they fit into the API landscape

Designing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(13) API Products are Products

  • Products have consumers and should drive organizational value
  • API Products are a special kind of product with additional constraints
    • More a service than a (physical) product
    • Many APIs are not (directly) consumed by external consumers
    • API products are the used for composing digital value chains


Designing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(14) Product Marketing Mix: 4 Ps

  • Framework for decision-making for product marketing
    • Product: Good or service wanted by consumers
    • Price: What value is being exchanged for the product?
    • Place: How to make products available to consumers
    • Promotion: How to make consumers aware of products


Designing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(15) 4 Ps for APIs

  • Product: The capability available through the API
  • Price: How is the API driving value for producers/consumers?
  • Place: Make the API findable for internal/external consumers
  • Promotion: Making potential consumers aware of the API


Designing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(16) Expanded Product Marketing Mix: 7 Ps

  • Extends the 4 Ps [Product Marketing Mix: 4 Ps (1)] with a focus on services
  • Framework for decision-making for services marketing
    • People: Considerations regarding service consumers (UX/CX)
    • Process: Planning and managing service delivery
    • Physical Evidence: (Physical) context of service delivery


Designing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(17) 7 Ps for APIs

  • People: How does the API provide DX and enable UX
  • Process: How easy is it to start using the API?
  • Platform: What is the bigger context of API delivery?

(19) Nudging in Ecosystems



Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(20) API Guidelines as Shared Practices

  • More API teams mean more ways to solve the same problem
    • Solving API problems is not what teams should focus on
    • Solving API problems in a consistent way helps the API landscape
  • Communications across teams is a challenge
    • Complement channels with documentation of practices


Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(21) The Anatomy of a Good Guideline

  • Why does the guideline exist?
    • Rationale for creating the guideline
  • What can be done to address the described issue
    • At least one good solution for addressing the issue
  • How to implement the solution
    • At least one way to use the solution in practice
  • Testing that the guideline has been followed
    • Some tests can be automated but many will be by declaration or review


Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(23) API Guidelines in the Wild



Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(24) Getting Started

  • Start capturing feedback from API teams
    • Challenges along the way
    • Solutions they have found or implemented
    • Quantifying the time they spend with cross-cutting vs. domain tasks
  • Start editing and providing guidance that API teams can find and use
    • Tooling can be as simple as markdown and shared repositories


Building Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(29) Value-Oriented Canvases

  • A canvas is a strategic management template
  • It facilitates structured thinking and communications
  • It helps documenting the main value propositions


Managing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(30) Existing API Canvases

  • Microservice Design Canvas
    • Matt McLarty and Irakli Nadareishvili, "Streamlined Microservice Design in Practice", December 2017 [https://dzone.com/articles/streamlined-microservice-design-in-practice]
    • James Higginbotham's version [https://launchany.com/microservice-design-canvas/]
    • Chris Richardson's version [https://chrisrichardson.net/post/microservices/general/2019/02/27/microservice-canvas.html]
  • Value Proposition Interface (VPI) Canvas
    • Amancio Bouza, "How to Use the Value Proposition Interface Canvas", September 2019 [https://www.amanciobouza.com/post/how-to-use-the-value-proposition-interface-canvas]
  • APIOps API Canvases
    • API Value Proposition and API Business Model Canvases [https://www.apiopscycles.com/resources/api-canvas-instructions]


Managing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(31) Example Canvas



Managing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(32) Canvas Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "canvases": [
    { "canvas": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "type": "http://...",
        "name": "Issues Service",
        "description": "Manages the Issues...",
        "tasks": "- Create Issue ...",
        "dependencies": ""
}}]}}
  • canvas.json


Managing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(33) User Stories

  • User stories are a type of boundary object
  • They facilitate sensemaking and communication
  • They help teams document their understanding of a system and its context
As a <role> I can <capability>, so that <receive benefit>.


Managing Microproducts Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs

(34) API Story Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "stories": [
    { "story": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "title": "Customer engagement history",
        "as-a": "Marketing campaign manager",
        "i-can": "Access the history of our engagements with customers",
        "so-that": "I can better target and design our campaigns"
}}]}}
  • api-story.json

(36) Focus on API Value

  • APIs are necessary for the composable organization
  • Microproducts are necessary for the composable organization
  • Focusing on value helps to make the most out of your APIs


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Microproducts: Delivering Value Through APIs
